name: NJ PACT REAL Rules
description: Resilient Environments and Landscapes - updates coastal zone management rules to account for sea-level rise, requires climate-adjusted flood elevation (FEMA 1% storm + 5ft sea level rise)

name: Inland Flood Protection Rule
description: Amendment to State flood rules based on more recent NJ-specific rainfall data, updating building and stormwater design standards

name: Flood Disclosure Law
description: Requires sellers to disclose flood history, DEP to provide online mapping tool at flooddisclosure.nj.gov

name: Blue Acres Program
description: Voluntary buyout program for flood-prone properties, over 1,100 properties purchased since 1995

name: Shore Protection Fund
description: Established 1992, allows NJ to leverage Federal dollars for beach/dune restoration

name: Climate Change Cost Recovery
description: Vermont-style legislation to hold fossil fuel companies responsible for funding resiliency projects

name: Stormwater Utilities
description: Legal in NJ with DEP guidelines, only 1 municipality using them, 1,500 exist nationwide

name: Master Plan Climate Element
description: Requires sustainability and resilience elements in municipal master plans every 10 years

name: Resilient NJ Program
description: DEP local planning assistance program, worked with over 40 municipalities

name: Water Infrastructure Center
description: Academic institution-based center to examine water and climate issues (Senator Greenstein bill)

name: Extreme Heat Resilience Action Plan
description: 135 specific actions for state agencies, third such plan in the nation

name: Executive Order 100
description: Governor directive to DEP to develop regulations for GHG mitigation and climate resilience

name: NOAA Climate Resilience Regional Challenge
description: $72 million award to DEP for Building a Climate-Ready NJ initiative
